title: The Assassin rework @meddler with poll
body:
So, I've recently seen on one of the forums from meddler saying that the assassins are getting a rework sometime in the near future, and I'd like to find out a few things about it from the community, and meddler himself.


1)  What is going to be changed on the Akali rework, or what is most likely going to be changed.  (I've been playing Akali for a long time now and I feel that her burst damage is insane, which needs to be changed, but what makes her unique is that her ult can stick on to people really easily.  Just an opinion from an Akali main

2)  What is going to be changed on Katarina?  (For this one, I'm hoping a near full blown rework since her kit is just extremely, I don't know how to describe it.)

3)Are you going to tamper with Diana if at all?  (Right now to me she seems like she's in quite a good spot right now and is pretty balanced, because in order to go in, you need to land your q, or be punished with doing basically no damage.  Maybe change her ult and how it works with her q but I think that's all she needs.)

4)  How are you going to touch Zed if at all?  (While I don't play much Zed, I think he's in a good spot right now, with a decent amount of counterplay, without being an underpowered snoozefest)

@Meddler and the community please respond

Thanks:)

replies.body: Our current focus is immobile mages for the middle of the year. After that we'll be looking at which class to tackle next, with assassins being one of the ones shortlisted, along with initiating tanks and diving fighters. It'll be a couple of months at least before we commit to a class for that slot and whichever one we choose won't have changes shipping until around November. That means it's really, really early to be talking about details for any individual champion. If we were to tackle assassins though the biggest issues would be adding clearly different strengths to some of them and adding weaknesses that aren't just statistical (counterplay that's accessible to a wide range of enemies in particular).

Can I suggest that when you do look at assassins, they have more to their play style than "get in, press all the buttons, get out"? 

I personally consider Shaco a healthier assassin than Zed, because there's more to Shaco. Shaco's trying to outplay you, holding his E for your flash, trying to get you to be feared by a Jack in the Box, etc. Meanwhile Zed button mashes you to death, with whether you live or die depending on if you bought an item by that point in the game.
If we tackle assassins more distinct playstyles will be one of the big focuses, particularly for champions with excessively similar patterns like Talon, Kat and Akali.
I'd really love to see LeBlanc reworked to be more focused around her clones and being a deceiver instead of a burst assassin. I love her as she is now but I really wish she did more  with her clone.

I thought we wanted LESS shitty minigames?

As a LB main myself I wouldnt mind seeing changes to her kit allowing her more versatility while being less obnoxious to play against in lane but dont degrade another champion into a shitty mage (im looking at you {{champion:103}} )

Zed definitively need to be looked at and have some things changed. His damage output is fine, but his design is really unhealthy, as he's way too safe. If he could only go back if his target got killed, it would be cool (of course, he would need some buffs to compensate on his R, like a faster proc).

Right now, Zed is just anti-fun in most matches in midlane, with near to no weakness (can easely farm undertower, can easely waveclear minions, lots of safety when ganked and when assassinating, plenty of poke and harass in lane)

He's not broken, he just needs some tuning.

Katarina shouldn't be drastically changed. Let me explain:

As a Kat main, I particularly enjoy playing her. She's fast-paced, funny, and reliant on godlike reflexes if you want to be good with her. The problem with Kat is that her kit works very differently based on who are you playing against. 

If you play against a newbie team, it's EXTREMELY EASY to carry with katarina. Smash all buttons, get da' pentakills! But if you play against good people, then it becomes EXTREMELY HARD. 

This happens because Kat has two huge advantage points, and two huge disadvantage points. The multi-objective, high-damage R, along with the resets, are her best things, but her extreme weakness at early game and the fact that more than aproximatedly 2/3 of the champs of the game can stop her ult, are her biggest killers.

IMHO, kat needs more a buffing rework than a nerfing one. She has many abilities that shouldn't change after all, as they are her W and E. I'd change the Q to be a skillshot though, and to have a higher pop damage. Also, I'd slightly rework her R in a way you can focus somebody (you must have the mouse on them to make them more dmg), or being able to shunpo while in R to dodge skillshots.

So, I think you should have an eye in making the R more skillful, but also, more rewarding. Her Q could change a lot IMHO, in a way she can use it for better early farming and deal damage by going all-in, more than just throwing the Q away to poke like we Kats currently do.

I think another interesting thing to change, is to buff her W passive thingy, the MS speedup that you receive when using it on an enemy champion. But all the important is already said.
